{{infobox character | people=[[Edain|Adan]] | name=Belegund | image= | caption= | pronun= | othernames= | titles= | position= | location= | affiliation=[[Barahir's outlaws]] | language= | birth={{FA|422}} | birthlocation= | rule= | death={{FA|460}} | deathlocation=[[Tarn Aeluin]] | age=38 | notablefor= | house=[[House of Bëor]] | parentage=[[Bregolas]] | siblings=[[Beleth]] and [[Baragund]] | spouse= | children=[[Rían]] | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Belegund''' ({{FA|422}}-{{FA|460|n}}) was a descendant of [[Bëor]], and one of [[Barahir]]'s [[Barahir's outlaws|twelve followers]]. == History == Belegund was the younger son and third child of [[Bregolas]]. His brother was [[Baragund]] who was elder to him, and his sister was [[Beleth]] who was the eldest among his siblings. Belegund had only one daughter, [[Rían]], with an unnamed wife.{{WJ|14}}, ''(i) House of Bëor'', p. 231 Belegund and his brother Baragund partook in the [[Dagor Bragollach]] under the command of their uncle [[Barahir]] who was their father's brother. They survived, but were beaten back.{{S|Fingolfin}} With Barahir and ten others, they formed a small band and lived as outlaws in [[Dorthonion]], near [[Tarn Aeluin]]. They lived in hiding for some time, until [[Morgoth]]'s agents captured [[Gorlim]] and coerced him into giving the location of their hideaway. [[Orcs]] were sent to raid it, and succeeded. Belegund and the outlaws were killed. Only [[Beren]] survived, as he had been away on an errand.{{S|Beren}} Belegund was the grandfather of [[Tuor]] by Rían his daughter. == Genealogy == {{familytree/start}} {{familytree | | | | | | | | | BRE | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | |BRE=[[Bregor]]
